dataset.title: Bathymetry and watershed area for Falling Creek Reservoir, Beaverdam Reservoir, and Carvins Cove Reservoir

abstract.para: This data package includes bathymetric data and watershed delineations for Falling Creek (FCR), Beaverdam (BVR), and Carvins Cove (CCR) Reservoirs, all located near Roanoke, VA, USA. Bathymetric data were collected using an Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler (ADCP) and processed using WinRiver II, USGS Velocity Mapping Toolbox, and ArcGIS. Water level can vary in these reservoirs; at the time of ADCP measurement, maximum depth was ~10.1 m in FCR, ~11 m in BVR, and ~23 m in CCR. Bathymetric data are presented in two forms: (1) as hypsometric summaries of surface area and volume for 0.5 m depth intervals (for all three reservoirs) and (2) as 2 m contour spatially-explicit shapefiles and triangular irregular networks (TIN) files for all three reservoirs. Watershed areas are included as shapefiles for each reservoir.

additionalInfo.para: The WVWA oversaw and supported bathymetry collection in its three reservoirs. PAG led ADCP measurements and analysis in FCR. KAB led ADCP measurements and analysis in BVR and CCR with help from JCL, CCC, and DWH. CCC and ASL coordinated data documentation and publication. Watershed delineations were led by DWH (CCR) and WMW (FCR + BVR).

Where appropriate, the Data User is encouraged to consider collaboration or co-authorship with the authors. The Data User should realize that misinterpretation of data may occur if used out of context of the original study. While substantial efforts are made to ensure the accuracy of data and associated documentation, complete accuracy of data sets cannot be guaranteed. All data are made available "as is." The Data User should be aware, however, that data are updated periodically and it is the responsibility of the Data User to check for new versions of the data. The data authors and the repository where these data were obtained shall not be liable for damages resulting from any use or misinterpretation of the data. Thank you.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Beaverdam Reservoir is located in Vinton, Virginia, USA
Falling Creek Reservoir is located in Vinton, Virginia, USA
Carvins Cove Reservoir is located in Roanoke, Virginia, USA

description.para: Bathymetric data for Falling Creek Reservoir, Beaverdam Reservoir (Vinton, VA, USA), and Carvins Cove Reservoir (Roanoke, VA, USA) were estimated following standard methods (e.g., Wahl and Vermeyen 1998). All three reservoirs are owned and operated as either primary (FCR and CCR) or secondary (BVR) drinking water supplies by the Western Virginia Water Authority (WVWA). The data were collected using an Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler (ADCP; RD Instruments, San Diego, CA, USA) operated from a moving boat when both reservoirs were at full pond: ~10.1 m for Falling Creek Reservoir, ~11 m for Beaverdam Reservoir, and ~23 m for Carvins Cove Reservoir. Global positioning system (DSM 232 GPS Receiver, Trimble) data were collected simultaneously with the ADCP data collection over multiple transects across both waterbodies. Data from Carvins Cove Reservoir were collected in summer/fall 2012. Data from Falling Creek Reservoir were collected in July 2023 and from Beaverdam Reservoir in April 2024. The ADCP and GPS data were processed using WinRiver II software (RD Instruments) and USGS Velocity Mapping Toolbox. To determine hypsometric contours, summary statistics were generated using the Surface Volume (3D Analyst) tool in the 3D Analyst Toolbox in ArcGIS (Esri, Redlands, CA, USA). The data are presented as hypsometric relationships of surface area and volume for 0.3-1.0 m depth intervals in the two reservoirs, as well as in spatially-explicit shapefiles and triangular irregular networks (TIN) files. FCR and BVR spatial bathymetry files use the D North American 1983 coordinate system. CCR spatial bathymetry files use the WGS 1984 UTM Zone 17N coordinate system. A comprehensive document outlining the standard operating procedure for the ADCP - from ADCP setup to post data processing - is available (file ADCP_SOP.pdf). A script, titled Bathymetry Map and Calculation, is included and can be used to produce a bathymetric map in leaflet in RStudio. It uses ADCP depth data that has been processed in VMT, converts the points to NAD 1983 UTM zone 17N, and generates a raster. The raster is then used to create the map, as well as calculate surface area and volume according to equations from Manual of Fisheries Survey Methods II (Taube, 2000). The ArcGIS files included in this package, allow users to create a detailed bathymetric map of all three reservoirs from various shapefiles and TIN files. Note that the Virginia Rivers and Streams shapefiles were retrieved from the NHDPlus dataset from the USGS TNM Downloader V2, and Digital Elevation Model (DEM) data was obtained through Virginia LiDAR download application.

Watershed delineation for CCR was conducted using the StreamStats basin delineation tool provided by the United States Geological Survey (USGS; https://streamstats.usgs.gov/ss/). Watershed delineation for FCR and BVR was conducted within ArcGIS Pro using the National Aeronautics and Space Administration's Advanced Spaceborne Thermal Emission and Reflection Radiometer 15 second global digital elevation mode (NASA ASTER GDEM) and the HydroSHEDS stream network layer (Lehner et al. 2008) following the method outlined in Merwade (2012). FCR and BVR watershed files use the D North American 1983 coordinate system. CCR watershed files use the WGS 1984 coordinate system.
Lehner B, Verdin K, Jarvis A. 2008. New global hydrography derived from spaceborne elevation data. Eos Trans AGU. 89:93â€“94.
Merwade V. 2012. Watershed and stream network delineation using ArcHydro tools. Purdue (IN): University of Purdue, School of Civil Engineering, Printed Lecture Note.

Taube, C. M. 2000. Instructions for winter lake mapping. Chapter 12 in J. C. Schneider, editor. Manual of fisheries survey methods II: with periodic updates. Michigan Department of Natural Resources, Fisheries Special Report 25, Ann Arbor, Michigan, USA. https://www2.dnr.state.mi.us/publications/pdfs/DNRFishLibrary/Special-ManagementReports/SR25.pdf
U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). 2024. NHDPlus dataset. https://www.epa.gov/waterdata/get-nhdplus-national-hydrography-dataset-plus-data.
U.S. Geological Survey, 2016, The StreamStats program, online at http://streamstats.usgs.gov, accessed on (27 October 2022).
Virginia Geographic Information Network (VGIN). 2024. DEM data. Virginia LiDAR Download Application. https://vgin.vdem.virginia.gov/apps/VGIN::virginia-lidar-download-application/explore.
Wahl, T. and T. Vermeyen (1998). Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler (ADCP) Measurements of Velocity Fields on Upper Klamath Lake Approaching the A-Canal Intake. USBR Report.

dataTable.entityDescription: Data table including bathymetric summary statistics for the three reservoirs

attribute.attributeDefinition: Three-letter code corresponding to sampled reservoir
Total surface area of the reservoir at this depth
Volume of water between this depth and the next (deeper) depth below it
Total volume of water below this depth

otherEntity.entityDescription: Spatial data for bathymetry from all reservoirs
SOP for ADCP operation and post-processing of data and GIS file generation
